movies.title: Cinema Six
movies.plot: Hilarity ensues as a trio of friends who "work" at the Stanton Family Cinema must finally face the music of real life: keep their sweet slacker theater jobs or grow up?
movies.simplePlot: Hilarity ensues as a trio of friends who "work" at the Stanton Family Cinema must finally face the music of real life: keep their sweet slacker theater jobs or grow up?

biography.bio: John Merriman is an actor and director, known for Gretchen (2006), You Hurt My Feelings (2011) and Pit Stop (2013).
biography.name: John Merriman

biography.bio: Brand Rackley starred in the 2006 indie award-winning cult hit, "The Stanton Family Grave Robbery." His portrayal of a jaded ladies' man in the 2008 film "Simmons on Vinyl" received rave reviews from audiences and critics alike, as well as the Grand Jury Prize at the 2010 deadCENTER Film Festival. His third feature, "S&M Lawn Care," received the special Jury Prize at the 2010 Friars Club Film Festival, and critics praised Rackley's villainous turn in the film. Rackley has recently starred in "Roark Comptons: The Motion Picture," as well as a cameo in "Pictures of Superheroes." Rackley had a starring role as one of the three leads in 2011's "Cinema Six", which premiered at the 2012 Dallas International Film Festival and has been accepted to the deadCENTER Film Festival. He recently worked with Fox Digital Studios to pitch new web series. Rackley has starred in films with Helen Thomas, Barry Corbin and Bill Hader and has most recently been featured in films with Sienna Miller and Eric Roberts. He has also starred in hundreds of short films including the acclaimed "Edgar Freezes," "The Bedazzler," and the internet sensation, "KANE." Rackley also starred in the short film, "Hitboys II Men," which was featured on MTVU's Best Film On Campus. Rackley's newest short film in which he has the starring role, "Busch Country," is making the rounds on the festival circuit. Recently he performed at the Actors' Studio West. Rackley is currently producing and starring in various web series for 20th Century Fox's Fox Digital Studios, MSN.com, RooftopComedy.com, FilmThreat.com and Singletree Productions. He has also been featured on such film websites as Cinematical.com, SlashFilm.com, FilmDrunk.com, FilmSchoolRejects.com and Slackerwood.com. Rackley acts in various film and commercial productions in Oklahoma, Texas, Chicago, New York City and Los Angeles. Rackley graduated from the University of Oklahoma in 2010. He resides in Los Angeles, California.
biography.name: Brand Rackley

biography.bio: Mark Potts was once described by the Huffington Post as a, "man child." He co-founded Singletree Productions in 2006 and the company went on to make numerous award-winning short films and feature films. "Cinema Six" played numerous film festivals and starred John Merriman ("Pit Stop," "Pictures of Superheroes"), Maggie Carey ("The To Do List"), and Barry Corbin ("Anger Management," "No Country For Old Men"). His film before that, "S&M Lawn Care," won a Special Jury prize at the 2012 Friars Club Comedy Film Festival. His newest film "Spaghettiman," is a new feature film with his comedy team, Heckbender. It is currently available for purchase and rental on all major platforms. Heckbender and its videos have been featured on Huffington Post, Slashfilm, Birth.Movies.Death, Sports Illustrated, and Funny or Die. He lives in Los Angeles and works as an editor for the Los Angeles Times and various other organizations. He wrote this biography himself in third person. He is moderately sad by this fact.
biography.name: Mark Potts

biography.bio: Byron Brown is an actor and director, known for Roosevelt's Big Deal (2011), Pictures of Superheroes (2012) and Austin High (2011).
biography.name: Byron Brown

biography.bio: Lindsey Newell is known for her work on L.A. Fadeaway (2016), Life's A Bitch, and Then You're Dead (2013) and Radio Silence (2013).
biography.name: Lindsey Newell

biography.bio: Heather Nichole Wallis was born in Baton Rouge, Louisiana and grew up between New Orleans, LA and Houston, Texas. She graduated from The University of the Arts in Philadelphia with a BFA in Theater before going on to receive her second BFA in Interior Design from the Art Institute of Austin. Heather is an award-winning actress who has appeared in films, television and on stage and has over twenty years dance experience. Heather was most recently seen as the lead in the critically-acclaimed, award-winning festival hit Paradise Recovered and the raunchy comedy Cinema Six. In addition, Heather has worked behind the camera as a producer. In 2010, she started her own production company, Chuck and Lou Productions, which is currently in pre-production on the feature film Becoming French. Heather resides in Austin, Texas.
biography.name: Heather Wallis

biography.bio: Madi Goff is an actress, known for Friday Night Lights (2006), Ashley (2013) and Housewarming (2017).
biography.name: Madi Goff

biography.bio: Eloise Kropp is an actress, known for Cinema Six (2012), Broadway Draft 2015 (2015) and Broadway.com #LiveatFive (2015).
biography.name: Eloise Kropp

biography.bio: Chris Doubek is an actor, known for Boyhood (2014), I Don't Feel at Home in This World Anymore (2017) and Krisha (2015).
biography.name: Chris Doubek

biography.bio: Cole Selix is an actor and writer, known for S&M Lawn Care (2010), For the Love of Family (2006) and Simmons on Vinyl (2009).
biography.name: Cole Selix

biography.bio: Kevin M. Brennan is an actor and producer, known for The Lake House (2006), It's a Disaster (2012) and The Scenesters (2009).
biography.name: Kevin M. Brennan

biography.bio: Maggie Carey is a writer and director, known for The To Do List (2013), Silicon Valley (2014) and Unbreakable Kimmy Schmidt (2015). She has been married to Bill Hader since 2006. They have three children.
biography.name: Maggie Carey

biography.bio: Barry's full given name is Leonard Barrie Corbin, and he was born on October 16, 1940 in Lamesa, Texas, to Kilmer Blain Corbin, an attorney, and Alma Corbin, an elementary school teacher. Barry has a daughter named Shannon Ross, with whom he shares his 15-acre ranch in Fort Worth, Texas, when he isn't working. He says that he rides horses there every chance he gets.
biography.name: Barry Corbin

biography.bio: Shannon McCormick is an actor, known for Red vs. Blue: Reconstruction (2008), Les Misérables (1998) and Pictures of Superheroes (2012).
biography.name: Shannon McCormick

biography.bio: Kelli Bland is an actress and producer, known for Anarchy for Breakfast (2008), Results (2015) and Receive Bacon (2009).
biography.name: Kelli Bland

keywords: written and directed by cast member
